Question
========

In order to compare two populations, a sample is drawn with the following results:______________. Group 1: n = 10, mean = 107, variance = 400. Group 2: n = 12, mean = 112, variance = 484. When testing two-sidedly (with α = 0.05) the hypothesis that the population averages are equal, the limits of the critical area are equal to

Answerlist
----------

* ±1.7171
* ±1.7247
* ±2.0739
* ±2.0860

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

±1.7171: Incorrect ±1.7247: Incorrect ±2.0739: Incorrect ±2.0860: Correct
